pages.title: Overview
pages.purpose: Introduce the Miso framework, its philosophy, key features, and how it supports native mobile application development

pages.title: Getting Started
pages.purpose: Provide a quick start guide with a simple counter example, explaining the basic Model-View-Update pattern and how to run a Miso application

pages.title: Core Architecture
pages.purpose: Deep dive into the fundamental architecture: the MVU pattern, application lifecycle, and how the different layers interact

pages.title: Application Lifecycle and Runtime
pages.purpose: Explain how Miso applications start, the event loop, action processing, and the Component runtime system

pages.title: Component System
pages.purpose: Document the Component type, component mounting with the +> operator, lifecycle hooks, and inter-component communication (Bindings, Mail, Pub/Sub)

pages.title: Virtual DOM Implementation
pages.purpose: Explain the virtual DOM architecture, the TypeScript diff/patch algorithm, and how VTree structures are managed

pages.title: Building User Interfaces
pages.purpose: Guide to constructing views using Miso's DSLs for HTML, SVG, MathML, and Canvas

pages.title: HTML, SVG, and MathML Elements
pages.purpose: Document the element constructors, properties, attributes, and how to build declarative UI trees

pages.title: Event Handling
pages.purpose: Explain event delegation, event types, decoders, event options (preventDefault/stopPropagation), and how events become actions

pages.title: Canvas Drawing
pages.purpose: Document the Canvas DSL for imperative 2D graphics with the Canvas monad

pages.title: State Management and Side Effects
pages.purpose: Comprehensive guide to managing application state, performing side effects, and handling asynchronous operations

pages.title: The Effect Monad
pages.purpose: Document the Effect RWS monad, how to schedule side effects, the Sink type, and effect combinators

pages.title: Lens-Based State Updates
pages.purpose: Explain the Lens system, state update operators (.=, %=, +=, etc.), and Template Haskell lens generation

pages.title: Subscriptions
pages.purpose: Document the subscription system for external events: keyboard, mouse, window, WebSocket, history, and custom subscriptions

pages.title: Routing and Navigation
pages.purpose: Explain type-safe routing with the Router type class, URI handling, history management, and the routerSub subscription

pages.title: Network Communication
pages.purpose: Guide to making HTTP requests, using WebSockets, and Server-Sent Events from Miso applications

pages.title: HTTP Requests with Fetch
pages.purpose: Document the Fetch API wrapper, making requests, handling responses, and error handling

pages.title: WebSockets and Server-Sent Events
pages.purpose: Explain real-time communication with WebSockets and EventSource, connection management, and message handling

pages.title: JavaScript FFI Integration
pages.purpose: Deep dive into the FFI architecture, the bridge between Haskell and JavaScript, and the context abstraction system

pages.title: FFI Bridge Architecture
pages.purpose: Explain JSaddle, the JSM monad, callback creation, and how Haskell functions are exposed to JavaScript

pages.title: Custom Rendering Contexts
pages.purpose: Document the context abstraction layer (drawingContext, eventContext, etc.) and how to create custom renderers for non-browser targets

pages.title: Server-Side Rendering and Hydration
pages.purpose: Explain isomorphic applications, server-side rendering with the ToHtml typeclass, and client-side hydration

pages.title: Build System and Development
pages.purpose: Comprehensive guide to building, developing, and deploying Miso applications across multiple targets

pages.title: Compilation Targets
pages.purpose: Explain the different compilation backends: GHCJS, GHC WASM, JSAddle, and native GHC for SSR

pages.title: Nix Build System
pages.purpose: Document the Nix flake structure, overlays, package definitions, and how to use Nix to build Miso projects

pages.title: Development Environment
pages.purpose: Guide to setting up development shells, hot-reload with JSAddle and ghcid, HLS integration, and development workflows

pages.title: CI/CD Pipeline
pages.purpose: Document the GitHub Actions CI setup, Cachix integration, and automated testing across all compilation targets

pages.title: Testing and Quality Assurance
pages.purpose: Guide to testing Miso applications, the TypeScript test suite, and ensuring code quality

pages.title: Module Reference
pages.purpose: Comprehensive reference of all exposed modules in the Miso library, organized by functionality

pages.title: Example Applications
pages.purpose: Walkthrough of example applications demonstrating different Miso features and patterns
